editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msItem.note: ff. iii, iv-vv blank. On f. iiiv is a table of contents, little later than the main text, keyed to the foliation. It shows that the missing f. 118 contained ‘Liber Metodii de tempore Antechristi et de die iudicii’, which went as far as 118v or 119, on which began art. 20. Curiously, these two arts. are listed separately, at the end of the table. Doubtless this attracted the attention of a Protestant fellow, and accounts for their removal. The remover presumably did not realize that art. 20 continued much further on in the book.

msItem.title: ‘De adoratione, latria, hyperdulia et dulia libellus’
msItem.incipit: Latria est honor soli Deo debitus
msItem.explicit: Sed iste actus uoluntatis est uere adoracio
msItem.note: Also in CCCC 365, ff. 143v–5, with a different ending.

msItem.author: Ps.-Bonaventure
msItem.title: Centiloquium
msItem.rubric: Incipit paruum bonum fratris SS. Bonauenture quod a quibusdam uocatur meditatio eius
msItem.incipit: Ecce tripliciter tibi eam descripsi Prov. 22. Cum omnis scientia gerat Trinitatis insigne
msItem.explicit: prima tronorum 2a cherubin 3a seraphin amen
msItem.note: pr. Strassburg, 1489 &c.; Glorieux, Théol. 305cb.

msItem.title: ‘Liber de natura rerum’
msItem.incipit: Iulius Siluius dicit quod aquila que acuti luminis dicitur in alto enim ascendit
msItem.explicit: saxa penetrat et ypocritas signat
msItem.note: Bloomfield 2875, this copy only. In alphabetical sections, Aquila – Ysopus. On ff. 16–17v is an analytical index in 2 cols, organized by moralistic topics, Abstinencia – Ypocrisis.

msItem.author: ?Thomas Sutton OP
msItem.title: De Vita Apostolica
msItem.incipit: Quia quidam emuli nostri impugnant in nos dicentes quod ordo predicatorum non seruet formam apostolorum
msItem.explicit: sed magis consonum et apertum. Explicit uita apostolica
msItem.note: unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 684, one of two copies.

msItem.author: Walter Hilton OESA
msItem.title: De Adoratione Imaginum
msItem.incipit: Numquid Domini nostri crucifixi et beate Marie ac reliquorum sanctorum
msItem.explicit: in claritate uisionis beate. Ad quam ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de adoracione ymaginum secundum Thomam Palmer fratrem predicatorem et professorem theologie
msItem.note: ed. J. P. H. Clark and C. Taylor, (Analecta Cartusiana 124: Salzburg, 1987), pp. 179-214; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 735; J. M. Russel-Smith, ‘Walter Hilton and a tract in defence of the veneration of images’, Dominican Studies 7 (1954), 180–214. Also in MS 175, there ascr. to John Sharpe.

msItem.author: ?Giles of Rome OESA
msItem.title: De Originali Peccato
msItem.rubric: Tractatus de originali peccato secundum Palmer ut dicitur
msItem.incipit: Ego cum sim puluis et cinis loquar ad Dominum Deum meum
msItem.explicit: ut facie ad faciem te uidere posse possimus qui ...
msItem.note: unpr.; Glorieux, Théol. 400h; G. Bruni, Le opere di Egidio Romano (Florence, 1936), p. 120 no. 41; Bloomfield 1886; Sharpe, Handlist , p. 674, rejecting the implication of the explicit, that the author was Thomas Palmer OP.

msItem.author: JOHN DEVEROSE
msItem.title: De Materia Peregrinationis
msItem.incipit: In materia peregrinacionis dicendum in materia peregrinacionis est licitum est peregrinari hominibus
msItem.explicit: et execrabiliter sunt excecati
msItem.note: unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 235. Also in MS 175, there ascr. to John Sharpe.

msItem.author: Petrus Alfonsi
msItem.title: Dialogus contra Iudaeos
msItem.incipit: Quid adhuc quasi in thesauro reseruaui tibi
msItem.explicit: et alius catholicus Christianus amen
msItem.note: The complete text PL 157. 535-672; ed. K. P. Meith (Berlin, 1982); Diaz 893. It follows art. 7 again in MS 175.

msItem.author: Robert Allington
msItem.title: Determinatio de Adoratione Imaginum
msItem.incipit: Pro materia de adoracione ymaginum est notandum secundum doctorem solempnem
msItem.explicit: in celis triumphat amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit determinatio M. Roberti Alyngton de adoracione ymaginum
msItem.note: unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 522; one of three known copies.

msItem.author: Thomas Aquinas
msItem.title: De Iudiciis Astrorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de iudiciis astrorum secundum Thomam de Alquino
msItem.incipit: Quia petisti ut tibi scriberem an liceret iudiciis astrorum incendere
msItem.explicit: dependent iudiciis astrorum uti
msItem.note: ed. R. A. Verano and R. M. Spiazzi, Opuscula Theologica (Turin/Rome, 1954), I, p. 155; Glorieux, Théol. 14cn; TKI 1227.

msItem.title: ‘De obseruatione sabbati tractatulus.’
msItem.incipit: Quia de tercio precepto prime tabule scilicet de sacrificacione sabbati
msItem.explicit: et commode prouideri quod Deus concedat amen
msItem.note: Bloomfield 4674, this copy only.

msItem.author: ?GILBERT THE MINORITE
msItem.title: Liber de Exemplis Sacrae Scripturae
msItem.incipit: Tanta pollet excellentia predicacionis officium
Abstinentia et ieiunium: precepit Dominus Ade Ge. ex omni ligno paradisi comode
msItem.explicit: quod a Paulo dicebantur Act. 13
msItem.note: unpr.; Bloomfield 5978, 0143. The ascription of the prologue is uncertain. This copy is, apparently wrongly, listed under Bloomfield 1006. Followed, on ff. 63-4, by an alphabetical word-index, Abstinencia—Zelum.

msItem.author: Ps.-Robert Grosseteste (Malachius Hibernicus)
msItem.title: De Venenis
msItem.incipit: Racio ueneni potissime conuenit peccato
msItem.explicit: aliis pretermissis et derelictis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractus de veneno et eius remediis
msItem.note: pr. Paris 1518; Thomson, Grosseteste, pp. 268-70; Bloomfield 5102.

msItem.title: Stimulus Conscientiae
msItem.note: (Latin translation)
msItem.incipit: Ab eterno et ante tempora fuit Deus semper idem
msItem.explicit: intra in gaudium Domini tui ad quod gaudium nos peruenere concedat qui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus qui uocatur stimulus conscientie secundum Hampole
msItem.note: unpr.; Allen, Richard Rolle, p. 376; Bloomfield 0031, 1543.

msItem.author: Richard Rolle
msItem.title: Emendatio Vitae
msItem.rubric: Hic libellus est de emendacione uite siue de regula uiuendi
msItem.incipit: Ne tardes conuerti ad Dominum
msItem.explicit: ipsum eternaliter laudare cui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt xii. capitula Ricardi heremite de modo uiuendi in uita contemplatiua &c
msItem.note: pr. Paris 1510 &c.; ed. N. J. Watson (Toronto, 1995), pp. 33-68; Allen, Richard Rolle, p. 234; Bloomfield 3191; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 502.

msItem.title: Commentary on ‘Placebo Domino in regione uiuorum.’
msItem.incipit: Placebo Domino in regionem uiuorum. I shall please my Lorde by worching in the regioun of them that be levyng. Forma placendi Domino notatur Michie sexto
msItem.explicit: ubi est uita sine morte ad quam regionem nos perducat qui cum Patre

msItem.author: Ps.(?)-Richard Rolle
msItem.title: Paruum Iob
msItem.incipit: Parce mihi Domine ...; Lord for thi mercy thou me spare / Forsothe my dayes to note bethe fare. Ista fuerunt uerba beati Iob
msItem.explicit: in numero seruorum Dei computemur ipse nobis concedat qui ...
msItem.note: The verses IMEV 1950, this copy only. The main treatise ed. M. R. Moyes, Elizabethan and Renaissance Studies 92/12 (Salzburg, 1988); Sharpe, Handlist, p. 503. Text, beginning ‘Tabula’, has been erased from the rest of the column.

msItem.author: JOHN EYTON OA
msItem.title: De Vsuris
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in tractatum de usura
msItem.incipit: Appropinquante termino mundi huius
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus magistri Iohannis Eytone canonici de Repindano de usura quem composuit anno Domini 1387 tunc regens Oxonie in theologia
msItem.incipit: Sicut eius quod est in se decorum
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in c. 7) secundum Parisiensem comparatur usurarius cuiusdam
msItem.note: unpr.; Bloomfield 5719; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 242.

msItem.author: John Wykeham
msItem.title: Quaestiones quas mouet Notyngham
msItem.rubric: Iste sunt questiones quas mouet Notyngham in scripto suo super euangelia extracte secundum ordinem alphabeticum per Mag. Ioh. Wykham. Sequitur Abel.
msItem.incipit: Queritur super 1o dicto Mt. 23
msItem.explicit: (Zizania) bono inquam per naturam Petr. 5. 15
msItem.note: unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 354, one of six copies. Followed by a table of gospel readings for the year (ff. 192-8), ending ‘Expliciunt questiones Notyngham super euangelia’, and an alphabetical index of the key-words, f. 198rv.

msItem.author: WILLIAM BUTLER OFM
msItem.title: Determinatio contra Translationem Scripturae in Linguam Vulgarem
msItem.incipit: intellexisse scripturam sacram et eam false composuisse
msItem.explicit: nimium excedente absque inpactiuorum uerborum misera Christianitate
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit determinacio fratris et magistri Willelmi Buttiler ordinis minorum regentis Oxonie anno Domini mcccc primo
msItem.note: The unique copy, ed. M. Deanesley, The Lollard Bible (Cambridge, 1920), pp. 399-418; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 757. At the foot of f. 199 a note refers back to the beginning of the text on ‘fo. 119’, i.e. the now-lost leaf before f. 118.

msItem.author: AUGUSTINUS TRIONFI OF ANCONA OESA
msItem.title: Quaestiones super Magnificat
msItem.note: Capitula f. 202rv.
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus fratris Augustini de Anchona sacre pagine professoris ordinis fratrum heremitarum S. Augustini super magnificat
msItem.incipit: Super illo uerbo Psalmi Deus canticum nouum cantabo tibi
msItem.explicit: in hora mortis anima nostra perducatur amen
msItem.note: pr. Lyon, 1506 &c.; Stegmüller, Bibl. 1548; Glorieux, Théol. 409j; Zumkeller 131, omitting this copy, which is the only known English one.

msItem.author: Thomas of Ireland
msItem.title: De Tribus Ordinibus Angelicae Hierarchiae et Ecclesiasticae
msItem.explicit: sacramentaliter absolui possunt &c.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de gerarchiis angelorum secundum beatum Dionisium
msItem.note: unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 661.

msItem.author: John Waldeby OESA
msItem.title: Homilies on the Lord’s Prayer or Itinerarium Salutis
msItem.incipit: Sepcies in die laudem dixi tibi Ps. centesimo xviii. Scribitur Eccl. xxxiii. Sic contra malum bonum est
msItem.explicit: qui dilexit nos et lauit nos a peccatis nostris in sanguine suo Ipsi gloria ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit itinerarium salutis fratris Iohannis Waldeby super orationem dominicam
msItem.note: unpr.; Stegmüller, Bibl. 5045-6; Bloomfield 9123; Zumkeller 617; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 336.

msItem.author: John Waldeby OESA
msItem.title: Homilies on Ave Maria
msItem.incipit: Vas electionis Paulus doctor gencium egregius scribens
msItem.explicit: ad laudis preconium cui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt quinque omelie ... secundum fratrem Iohannem Waldeby ordinis heremitarum beati Augustini
msItem.note: ed. M. J. Morrin (Studia Augustiniana Historica 2: Rome, 1975), pp. 81-153; Stegmüller, Bibl. 5048; Zumkeller 616; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 336, listing two copies, not this one.

msItem.author: John Waldeby OESA
msItem.title: Homilies on the Apostles’ Creed
msItem.incipit: Venerabili in Christo patri ac domino suo singularissimo domino Thome diuina prouidencia abbati de Sancto Albano
Cum in loco sacro Tynmowthe
Credo. Adiuua incredulitatem meam. Marc. Karissimi consideranti et superficialiter
Credo in Deum ...; Iste articulus repellit tres errores
msItem.explicit: auctor fidei nostre I. C. cui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit expositio super symbolum fidei secundum fratrem Iohannem Waldeby
msItem.note: unpr., except for the letter of dedication to Thomas de la Mare, abbot of St Albans, ed. F. Roth, The English Austin Friars 1249-1538: Sources (New York, 1961), pp. 588-9; Stegmüller, Bibl. 5049; Zumkeller 620; Bloomfield 1010; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 335, listing two copies, not this one. Followed by alphabetical indexes of subjects and words, ff. 291v-7v, 298, in 2 and 7 cols respectively. ff. 298v-9v blank.

supportDesc.extent:
307 (v + 302) leaves
355 265
255 190
The edges retrimmed and spattered with red.
supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary foliation included the now-missing ff. 118-20.
supportDesc.collation: A4(4 canc.), 1-912, 1012(lacks 10-12), 11-2512, a bifolium; catchwords; quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with pencil in 2 cols; written in c. 49 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Mainly in a single hand, writing a mixture of anglicana and secretary. Arts 18 and 20 are in a single secretary hand; the indexes on ff. 198rv and 298 are in another mixed hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: On f. 1 is a red and blue flourished initial with 1-sided border. Otherwise blue initials flourished in red; red paraphs, highlighting and underlining. Arts 18 and 20 lack decoration.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. ff. i-ii, 300-1 are paper binding leaves, the outermost from a printed copy of ‘Expositio Topicorum Aristotelis’, s. xvi. An earlier binding had two straps.

history.provenance: Bequeathed by Hammond Haydok (for whom see MS 16): his ex dono, cropped by the binder, is at the head of f. iv (only ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ ex’ is legible). Seen at Merton by John Bale (Appendix C, nos 28-9, 42, 54). Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with an elaborate table of contents, s. xvii, ‘N. 6. 2. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with modern ‘K. 2. 2’, in red, and the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 41-3; Powicke, no. 971; Dondaine & Shooner, no. 2145.
